Abstrak: The article focuses on visual literacy and the use of images for visual communication. It notes that there is a need to consider combining oral and visual messages in studying communication-related issues. It discusses message design, as well as its sub-areas and its role for visual literacists. It provides a definition of design science, and explains the classification of design terminology such as Families at the top level, Genera at the next level, and species at the third level.
